verb.description: (of a person or other living thing) lose or lack vitality; grow weak or feeble.
examples: plants may appear to be languishing simply because they are dormant

verb.description: Suffer from being forced to remain in an unpleasant place or situation.
examples: he has been languishing in jail since 1974

origin: Middle English (in the sense become faint, feeble, or ill): from Old French languiss-, lengthened stem of languir languish, from a variant of Latin languere, related to laxus loose, lax.
